title: Strand 3 Leaving Certificate Ordinary Level Numbers and Shapes
headline: This free online maths course looks at numbers and shapes, an important topic in the Irish Leaving Certificate exam.
description: Begin studying numbers and shapes for your Ordinary Level Leaving Certificate! This course is also suitable for anyone who needs a maths refresher on various numbers concepts. It uses real-life examples to explain the mathematical concepts connected to numbers and shapes. Review topics like geometric reasoning, numerous indices rules and various formulas for finding the area and volume of shapes (circles, triangles, trapeziums, etc.).
courseDescription:
Numbers and number patterns are the basic building blocks of algebra and arithmetic. And we cannot escape using numbers in our everyday lives, counting the minutes and hours of our day with our clocks, counting out cash to pay for items or services and much much more.

Applying arithmetic and geometric series in finance is examined through investments and loan repayments. Using AER (annual equivalent rate) and APR (annual percentage rate) when calculating your repayments is examined. Students then look at the concept of a complex number and are shown how to multiply, divide, add and subtract them.

Complex numbers can be used to represent the current flow in a circuit and they are widely seen in electronics generally. Numbers are used to measure the perimeter and area of many shapes (hexagons, rectangles, triangles, circles, trapeziums and parallelograms) and we also try to work out the volumes of solids such as cones, spheres, cylinders and hemispheres. Determining the area of various compound shapes is extremely vital for problems on the exam and in your real life, for instance, washing machines and buildings.
